properties.name: Actual location of WP Sacramento Depot
properties.description: Posted by WpfanAfter looking at the satellite photo\'s I realized my initial placement was off by a few blocks... This is the corrected placement. This depot was important to WP passenger operations. It was conveniently located near downtown Sacramento, with easy access by car.

properties.name: Beginning of Niles Canyon segment
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanniles, caBeginning (highest point) of Niles Canyon segment of the WP mainline

properties.name: Best place: Roserberg Junction
properties.description: Posted by Wpfan  Without a doubt, the best (and one of the safest) places to watch trains in the Houston area is here. During peak hours, which can happen almost any day, trains will go through here every 5 minutes. This is the intersection of the UP "Sunset Line" and the BNSF main to Galveston. Trains running between Mexico and the US and Canada are common here, making for interesting freight cars. The Rosenberg Train Museum is here, and a small section yard that usually has 1 or 2 switcher locomotives.

properties.name: Clio Trestle
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanportola, caA favorite offical photography site for the WP. Still a great viewing site. Can be viewed well from a distance from "County Hwy A15".

properties.name: Elko, Nevada
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanelko, nevadaThis community was served by the WP.

properties.name: Empire Branch
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThe 7-mile long Empire Branch was operated by US Gypsum, and served a production facility.

properties.name: End of Altamont Pass
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanlivermore, caApproximate end of Altamont Pass. This route was shared with the SP/Central Pacific mainline. The Altamont Pass area was prime viewing territory for railfans.

properties.name: End of Feather River Canyon segment
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis is the approximate end of the Feather River Canyon segment of the WP mainline

properties.name: End of Niles Canyon segment
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanniles, caEnd (lowest point) of the Niles Canyon segment of the WP mainline

properties.name: Flanigan, Nevada
properties.description: Posted by WpfanJunction with the SP Modoc line

properties.name: Ford Plant
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanniles, californiaA major track-side industry for the WP. The target for a lot of west-bound freight in the late 60\'s and 1970\'s. The plant and buildings are now mostly gone.

properties.name: Gerlach, Nevada
properties.description: Posted by Wpfangerlach, nevadaLocation of a small depot. Also the junction with the 7-mile long Empire Branch operated by US Gypsum.

properties.name: Herlong, California
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanherlong, californiaThere was a small station here, serving a location munitions storage base.

properties.name: Keddie Wye
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanquincy, californiaThe most distinctive location on the WP mainline. Still a famous viewing spot.

properties.name: Keddie Yard
properties.description: Posted by Wpfankeddie, caThe Keddie Yard was small and wound around a mountain. But it was busy, being located at the junction of the WP mainline and the leg to Bieber. The depot buildings are still there.

properties.name: Livermore Depot
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanlivermore, ca

properties.name: Marysville Station
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanmarysville, ca

properties.name: McAvoy
properties.description: Posted by Wpfan

properties.name: Navy Munitions Base (Clyde, CA)
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanclyde, caWP could serve the Navy munitions bases in Clyde and Port Chicago, CA. They were reached over SN trackage rights to the ATSF mainline through this area. This was the west-most point served by WP (and SN) along this track line.

properties.name: New Territory Siding
properties.description: Posted by WpfanLocated on the UP (ex-SP "Sunset Line"), this is a very-active railway -- as local residents can attest. More often than not there\'s a train parked on this siding. On busy days there will be 3 or 4 trains stacked up here, waiting for clearance to proceed. Many of my train pictures on www.fbmrc.com were snapped here.

properties.name: Nichols
properties.description: Posted by Wpfan

properties.name: Niles Junction
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanniles, californiaNiles Junction was the intersection of the WP and SP lines in Niles, California. It was protected by a control tower for many years.

properties.name: Oakland Passenger Terminal
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanwashington st, oakland, californiaThe west end of passenger operations for the WP mainline. The starting/stopping point for the California Zephyr after the Ferry Terminal was decommissioned.

properties.name: Oakland Yards
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanoakland, caThis was the main western terminal point for the WP freight operations.

properties.name: Oroville Depot
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanmarysville, caThe Oroville Depot was a major point on the WP mainline. Power was often exchanged or added here. There was a small rail yard. The depot was quite large.

properties.name: Pleasanton Station
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanpleasanton, ca

properties.name: Port Chicago Munitions Base
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanclyde, caThe WP could serve this munitions base -- but rarely did. This "industry" was reached via SN track rights to the ATSF mainline through here.

properties.name: Portola Yard
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanportola, californiaPortola was the logical mid-point of the WP mainline, and the location of a major yard and shops. The Portola Railroad Museum is now there, featuring WP locomotives and rolling stock.

properties.name: Reno Junction
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanportola, caReno Junction. The line to Reno is mostly used for rolling stock storage these days. Most traffic goes through on the mainline to the north here.

properties.name: Roper Yard (D&RGW)
properties.description: Posted by WpfanRoper Yard, owned by the D&RGW, was the eastern terminus of WP operations. Also a major throughpoint for the California Zephyr.

properties.name: Rosenberg Train Museum
properties.description: Posted by Wpfan  Right next to the best train viewing location in Houston, this museum is a worthwhile stop. The focus is railroad history in this area (Rosenberg was started as a railroad town).

properties.name: Rosenberg Train Yard
properties.description: Posted by WpfanA small yard, usually with 1 or 2 switcher locomotives (you can see 2 in this satellite photo). Main advantage is the location is right next to the best train viewing spot in the Houston area.

properties.name: Sacramento Depot
properties.description: Posted by Wpfansacramento, caApproximate location of the WP passenger depot in Sacramento.

properties.name: Sacramento River Ferry Terminal (North)
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThe Sacramento Northern crossed the Sacramento River here to serve freight and passenger desinations in Contra Costa County. When this track branch was damaged by flooding, this path was abandoned, and shared trackage on the AT&SF from Stockton was used instead. By that time, the US Steel plant in Pittsburg was virtually the only business still served in this area. On the satellite photo you can see the old ferry barges abandoned at this site.

properties.name: Sacramento River Ferry Terminal (South)
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis is the other end of the river crossing. Again, most of the original track and structure is gone. More comment and background is posted for the north side of this crossing.

properties.name: San Francisco Yard
properties.description: Posted by Wpfansan francisco, caThe western-most part of WP rail operations. Was reached by ferry across the Bay. Included a ferry landing and large rail yard.

properties.name: San Jose Yard
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanniles, californiaA small yard -- one of the western terminal points for the WP. (This location is a guesstimate; will be verified and updated as needed.)

properties.name: Start of Altamont Hills
properties.description: Posted by Wpfantracy, caApproximate start of the Altamont Hills section, the elevated hill crossing before reaching Oakland.

properties.name: Start of Feather River Canyon
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis is the approximate beginning (highest elevation) of the Feather River Canyon segment of the WP mainline route

properties.name: Sugar Land Viewing of the Sunset Line
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis is a fine low-traffic public spot to view trains on the ex-SP Sunset Line, a main railroad line across the southwest. Trains often go through here every 15-30 minutes. A broad array of locomotive and freight car liveries can be viewed (see the pictures in the referenced web page).

properties.name: Sunol Station
properties.description: Posted by Wpfansunol, caA small station; has been recently restored.

properties.name: Terminous terminal (approx location)
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis is the approximate location of the terminal building here. A large wooden structure, some of it built up on piers, I remember seeing it many times while riding with my parents along Hwy 12 in this area. It has now been torn down, and the tracks removed. The track spur approached from the east, originating in the Lodi area. It served the rich agriculture business in this area, once a hub for various fruit crops and asparagus.

properties.name: UP Sugar Land Yard
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis is a small yard that is getting much less traffic now that the Imperial Sugar Mill (right next door) is closed. The yard was built by the MP in the early 1900s, but now appears in jeopardy from local development plans. There are usually a few UP switcher locomotives here to handle local traffic.

properties.name: US Steel Plant
properties.description: Posted by WpfanThis facility was known as US Steel when it was served by the SN (WP), so it retains that name here (even though it\'s in different control now). Hauling intermediate steel components here from US Steel\'s plant in Genoa, Utah, was a major contract for SN for several decades. It was also the reason I saw WP trains in Antioch while growing up there in the 1960s.

properties.name: US Steel Yard (Pittsburg, CA)
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanpittsburg, caThe large US Steel factory in Pittsburg, CA, was a major trackside industry served by the WP. It was reached by SN track rights over the ATSF line from Stockton to Richmond.

properties.name: Wendover, Utah
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanwendover, utThis community was served by the WP. There was a large wooden WP depot here until 1965.

properties.name: West Pittsburg Yard
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanwest pittsburg, caThis tag is incorrectly placed. The actual location is at the nearby tag "McAvoy"

properties.name: Williams Loop
properties.description: Posted by Wpfanquincy, caAnother of the most distinctive features of the WP mainline. One of the few full loops on railroad mainlines in the US. Still a great viewing location.
